summary: Designed and built The Chronicle MVP - a persistent journalist agent with curator subagent for intelligent memory management.
goal: Create a system that remembers coding sessions, tracks pending work, and learns patterns over time
accomplished: Researched Letta framework (memory blocks, sleep-time compute, self-hosting)
Defined MVP: Continuity Threads for tracking pending work
Created pattern mining and preference learning designs
Built /chronicle skill with quick capture and curate modes
Created chronicle-curator subagent for intelligent memory curation
Committed design doc (1127 lines) to skills/chronicle/docs/
Created first memory block - Chronicle is bootstrapping itself
pending: Test /chronicle in new session (skill/agent discovery requires restart)
Implement Stop hook for automatic thread extraction
Backfill from last 30 days of history.jsonl
challenges: Skill and agent discovery require session restart - can't test live
nextSteps: Start new session to test /chronicle command
Use /chronicle curate daily to build intuition
Merge feat/chronicle-brainstorm to main once validated
notes: First Chronicle block, updated by manual curator run. The /chronicle pending command is now part of the skill spec - marking as done. The system is learning to track itself!
